description:
Loved the pork papusa! They were fast and friendly and the prices were very reasonable.  It is cash only but worth it. 

The guy working the counter was chatty and welcoming and happy to make a recommendation for me. I enjoyed the savory pork and cheese papusa and the fluffy yellow rice. The chips and salsa were tasty too.

2 Bean and Cheese burrito were hits but the chicken burrito was declared "thumbs down" - at least I ordered right!

Check them out for fast Salvadoran and Mexican food and great prices!
author: Mary G.

description: This is a simple salvadoranian restaurant, CASH ONLY! Upon seeing the menu, the prices were maybe a dollar more than I expected. The food portions were BIG and the quality of the pupusas was ! I ordered the carne asada fries and two pupusas. The food came out in less than 5 mins and was made fresh to order. The carne asada fries were topped with tons of beef and cheese. The potatoes were a little less crisp than I prefer, but they were hot and fresh!  I give this place a solid 4. Not life changing, but very good with nice serving sizes.
author: Phillip A.

description: The food is decent, but we ran into a little attitude with the matron. My wife asked to turn down the TV slightly, but the woman really didn't want to, and made that very plain. (My wife was in an accident last year, and her concussion symptoms have not gone away - loud noises are painful for her.) We hadn't been here for a while, and since the last time they have moved from simply Salvadoran to Salvadoran/Mexican. There's a better Mexican place a block away.
author: Steve D.

description: The cashier shy was rude and unprofessional shy should treat all clients the same shy have bad customers servy
author: Nadar R.

description:
I am completely blown away by the service here. Cash only place, okay, that's fine. We ordered a burrito and was told it was a minimum of 10$ to eat here. Weird, when I'm paying cash, that I have to pay 10$ minimum. (sharing my burrito with my co-worker) We asked them to cut the burrito in half. We were told that we would be charged an additional 2$ to share our burrito with each other. Ummm Excuse me???? You are going to charge me to share my burrito with someone?? I don't think so!! On we went, to find a taco spot that doesn't treat us like tourists. 

Business must be booming for you to treat people like that. The obviously don't need my patronage. That's okay by me. There are dozens of other places that are worth my money. 

I work one block away from this place, but will gladly walk further for better / Honest service.
author: Kat D.

description: Delicious burritos... they were so good we bought a soup for tomorrow.  Mmmm amazing salsa too.  Que rico!!!
author: Sarah B.

description: The food and the service was very good. Or food was ready in about 15 minutes. My date had the steak burrito which was very flavorful and huge. He also had 2 papusas on the side which he couldn't eat because he was so full. I had the papusa special with rice and beans. Prices were affordable and service was friendly. Would definitely come back again.
author: Raquel T.

description:
Bad service, mediocre food. Stopped in on a Saturday to disappointing results. The food was unremarkable and overpriced for what it was. I wouldn't have gone back based just on that. What really sealed it was how absolutely unpleasant the person at the counter was. No, it was not my privilege to be there. No, it shouldnt be a burden to you as the person taking orders to actually have to show some decent customer service.

Dumpy interior to match.
author: Ryan B.

description: Best chile rellenos I've ever had. Seriously, even better than the ones I ate in Cabo and Mazatlan! Nicest staff and fabulous food.
author: Dane W.

description: Two items Combo with Beef burrito, chicken enchiladas, refried beans, rice, & salad - Very delicious & good price!!  For sure will come back to try their pupusas.
author: Joyce I.

description:
Came here as a first timer and received HORRIBLE SERVICE. Will not ever return to this establishment. Right off the bat the lady was rude to our party of 6. Made a really bad deal when we asked if chips and salsa were free.. when we were only inquiring. Ok... didn't know we couldn't ask questions. 

You do realize being in this industry requires good customer service?
author: Sabrina Y.

description:
They charge a $15 min. just to eat in. Kind of ridiculous. Bad start. 
Can't give a good rating: mediocre asada fries
author: Marie C.

description: This place may be tiny but wow does their food pack a punch! We had a large group for lunch and they accommodated us easily. Their service was excellent and very upfront with us. Our waiter communicated well with wait times etc. This is a great and tasty place to have a meal.
author: Bri D.

description: Unimpressed. Came because of the good reviews but didn't care for the food. Salsa was runny and a bit spicy for me, the chips had almost no flavor. Ordered the house special catnitas plate. Carnitas were dry and over cooked, guacamole wasn't very good.  Tortillas, beans and rice were ok. There was a terrible smell while i was eating, it smelled like piss. It didnt seem to be the people eating near by, not sure if it was the food or a stench left on the chairs? Very unappetizing. Cost almost  $15 (well $17 if you count the atm fee) and i didn't finish my food or wrap it to go.
author: Jenne S.

description:
The Tenderloin can be diverse in many ways; the good, the bad and unfortunately the "butt-ugly"!

But for a Mexican restaurant in the Tenderloin, the $7.99 carne asada super burrito is really top notch and can give many taquerias in the Mission district a definite battle. All the key ingredients including the meat are really tasty and flavorful. 

As I was enjoying my meal, I was watching soap opera on the restaurant's television. I did shed tears in watching the program, but shed joy in my burrito. 

The restaurant serves other items, including the carne asada over French fries. I might try that on my next visit. 

The staff was nice and friendly.

Oh yeah, cash only and close on Sundays,
author: Matt G.

description:
I have been coming here at least once a week for the last few months and have yet to be disappointed. Great food, really affordable, quick service. It's nice to be able to support a small family business while getting stuffed on nachos.

Really friendly staff and pleasant service. Reminds me of a place I used to go back home.

Also - The breakfast burritos are the best in the neighborhood.
author: Nicholas F.

description:
I had the pupusas (one cheese/black beans and other cheese/pork), arroz y frijoles (black beans). I was uncertain about how it was going to be because of some of the more recent reviews but I was not disappointed.

The food tasted like it was made by a Salvadoran grandma, in other words, exactly as I'd expect. The rice tasted similar to my own abuelita's and the beans actually had flavor unlike many other places that only have burrito's. One reason I like this place is because it actually has food options and is not a burrito place under the name of Mexican food. However, the burrito my friend got was huge and she said it was great! The salsa was a bit spicy. Don't expect a bougie experience here, it's more of what I would say is authentic of what this kind of place should be. If you want to expand your Latin food palette, come give it a try!
author: Zachery M.

description:
Walked in to use the ATM and proceeded to the restroom after ASKING if it was ok to use and was told yes.

Then the employee banged on the door and yelled I could not use it, as they were closing in 45 min! After I told her I was there to use the ATM, she said ok use it. 

Come on, have some manners. Treat people kindly that are trying to give you business. 

A good attitude goes a long way, try treating people with respect and see what it brings to your business.
author: Blake C.

description: Used to live down the street. Really love the food here, it's delicious. I would recommend the burrito.
author: Tilly H.

description:
Sometimes a little spot you can just walk right by, in the blink of an eye, can be the worthiest place to try. Olivo's food is great! Especially if you're hungry... 

I was in need of a somewhat fast, low profile place to grab a casual bite with a friend in honor of his birthday. I was treating so, in this particular case, low budget, high food ratings were the two things that stood out to me the most, and the fact that there was an actual dining area, that was very modest, yet immaculately clean. 

I was super hungry, I wanted everything on the menu, but eventually opted for just one thing.  Between the mouthwatering Salvadoran options and Mexican fare, it was a tough call, but I decided to order the Two Pupusas plate. One Bean & Cheese, one Cheese & Vegetable. My friend ordered two tacos, which were gone from his plate in a matter of seconds... 

From the chips, to the salsa, to the fresh tasting dough from their handmade Pupusas, to even their amazing slightly spicy Saurkraut (not sure what it's referred to in Spanish); I was thoroughly satisfied. Life was good while I was here dining at Olivo's. The leftovers were just as incredible the second time around too. Enjoy!
author: Cassandra E.

description: I love the food here . One of the best restaurants I went to while visiting San Francisco . I will definitely go back when I'm in town
author: Diana G.

description:
Used to really enjoy this place. Food is good, but the waitress decided to treat us disrespectfully this time. We were 2 people at 7pm on a Saturday night in this empty restaurant, and we only wanted one burrito. The waitress wanted to impose a $15 minimum charge on us, claiming it was how their restaurant worked. 

We said we've dined here multiple times and no one has ever told us this. It's not written anywhere on the door or menu. No restaurant has ever done this, and tip covers whatever service they provide, so why does it matter how much we order? She claimed that previous occasions, no one bothered to say this, and ordering only one item for two people doesn't cover the cost of her three workers.... Well if we weren't there, no food would've been ordered anyways, and no revenue would be generated, so it wouldn't make a difference. 

We left because we were shocked at this apparent "minimum charge" that was never in place before, and we're never coming back.
author: Victor N.

description: Horrible service and bad attitude we simply asked if the chips are included with our order and they told us no you have to pay extra and we asked another person that was already sitting and eating and they said chips were free. I asked her why do we have to pay and other people don't? She then kicked us out and said I'm not serving you!! Wtf!? I have never experienced such horrible customer service in my life. EVER.
author: Colby J.

description:
The girl with the glasses behind the counter always look like someone spit on her food in the morning. I never want to come here, but the bf loves Mexican food. This was the worst and last time I step foot into this place. 
 There was no one at the counter when we walked in. The girl was on the other side of the wall just eating and didn't even bother getting up to seat us. The cook told us to sit wherever. So we only wanted to order super nachos and some drinks, and she follows by saying we need to pay a 10 dollar minimum. I tell her that I've been here before and was never that rule before. She goes on a whole explanation how rent is expensive and to seat people they need to spend 10 dollars min to be seated down. I look around and it is an empty restaurant and I call bs on that statement. It's two of us first of all. Is an extra chair on one table going to make a difference? So one person is sitting on the other side eating, did you make him pay 10 dollars too? She goes on to say she might as well close down the restaurant at this point. I'm thinking you might as well since you think it is such a privilege to sit in your run down restaurant and to deal with your prissy ass attitude and mediocre food. Never. Coming. Back.
author: J. G.

description: Small family feeling restaurant with a very authentic Mexican feel. We got both chicken and steak tacos and they were sensational, would highly recommend! A meal I won't forget!
author: John B.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised how good their food is. I wasn't sure at first, but another review said don't judge the book by its cover.
We ordered pupusas (cheese & pork) with rice and beans and a super burrito. The burrito was huge, and were both good. 
A couple issues, their bathroom wasn't working, tables were dirty, nothing ridiculous, but could use a wipe down, and they are a cash only establishment.
author: Jeannette C.

description: Its good but never know when they are open. Little hole in the wall but pretty good. Service sucks but what you expect from place with no hrs on yelp and.
author: Uuganbayar U.

description:
I can't believe it took me this long to dine at Olivo's, despite my living so close. I'm typing this review after having gorged on a delicious carne asada burrito (the meat is so good) and two cheesy pupusas. I can't even wait to go home before praising Olivo's and their friendly staff. I will be here more often. More than that, I plan on singing praises for this place to everyone I know.

Dining here is a joy. The food is fantastic and the prices are low. Come here immediately.
author: Keane L.

description:
I've come here for tacos and those were fine. 

Ordered a carne asada super burrito to go. Was impressed with size of the burrito until I started to eat it and realized all the sour cream and cheese were at the other end, it had beans, and the carne asada was minimal and stringy/gristley. For 9.22$ I ended up throwing half of it out. Would not come back.
author: Arin V.

description:
Food = good.

Table top chips and salsa = okay chips but awesome salsa, and the heat builds up every bite. 

Carnitas plate = perfect crispy but tender pork with rice, beans (black was my choice, refried and pinto are the other choices), guacamole, salsa and corn tortillas. $12.99.

Tamarindo = $2.50.

Seating = a few 2-tops and 4-tops. Small place. 

Service = friendly. 

Prices = reasonable. $16.85 for lunch with leftovers. Bring cash. Cash only.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Salsa was DEE-licious! Carne asada burrito was one of the best burritos I've ever had! Their food proportions are very satisfactory. Our server was VERY accommodating to the four of us and had a great personality. She even let us stay a few minutes past closing to order more beers! Speaking of beers, those were only 2-3 bucks apiece! Hard to beat!
  The only issues were that they only take cash and the restroom. The restroom seemed to be a bit on the fritz. These things happen. We didn't care, food was great, server was great.
   Olivo's is very unassuming, but deserves a chance.
author: jason y.

description:
I feel so fortunate to live so close to this amazing place.  It's a family restaurant where all the food is made from scratch and with care.  At Liz's suggestion, I've been branching out and trying many options from their menu.

It's great food that is reasonably priced made with fresh ingredients.  Anybody that questions the service is probably being a jerk. The family has been nothing but nice and charming with me.
author: Julie M.

description: Cute little neighborhood spot. The salsa that accompanies the chips and salsa is fab! The owner or manager on duty is super personable and it was nice to talk a quick walk from my hotel and get some good takeout. The chicken tacos were really flavorful, but I'll get some extra salsa to go on top next time.
author: N. S.

description: Olivo's is hands to the pants amazeballs. You absolutely must try this place. I am only saddened that I didn't find this place earlier. The super Carne Asada burritos are top notch as well as any of the quesadillas. If you want to try a variety of items get the combo with 3 items so you can see a range of what they have to offer. I also tried their papusas, maybe they just aren't my thing, but other things on their menu are better.
author: Andrew D.

description: Great food for a cheap price. This place is definitely no frills decoration and seating-wise, but the service is great and the food is very good. I got an enchilada with black beans and cleaned my plate so fast. Great spot for a bite!
author: Kristen T.

description:
Craving Mexican food, I turned to yelp to steer me in the right direction for lunch. My coworker was down so we decided to take a chance on Olivio's. 

They are cash only, but they have a ATM on site, so it was an easy fix. 

I ordered a Shrimp Super burrito which was around $8.00, yet HUGE. I ate 1/2 for lunch, 1/4 for dinner and the rest for breakfast! That's how big this was. It was so tasty, even the next day. They also come with chips and salsa. 

My coworker could not help himself and ended up eating the whole thing, which caused him to forever remember Olivio's as the biggest burrito around. It's worth every bite!
author: Rebekah T.

description: I've rarely had such bad service. We walked in, and a person in a bad mood took my order, then ignored me in favor of our Spanish speaking friend, to say there was a minimum dollar amount per person (even though it's already cash only). She left to pour someone else's drinks, then when she came back and we were ready to add to our order, she ignored both of us in favor of someone who had just walked in. They were nearly empty at the time (3:30pm on a Monday), so I don't understand any of this treatment, but we walked out and will not be coming back.
author: Jonathan H.

description: This is my first bad review I have ever written. I will never return to this establishment. It's not because of the rude lady that works the counter. It's because the carne asada burrito I ordered   for lunch awoke me from a restful sleep at 4am. My body deemed said burrito poisonous and wanted to rid itself of it, from both ends. I have never experienced food poisoning this painful and terrible in my nearly 40 years of life on this planet. Too bad, I liked the salsa.
author: Barkley L.

description:
Great Burrito, Great staff and good variety of food.
Be aware that you can only pay CASH though.
I had the Super Burrito with Carne Asada and some pieces of the meat haven't been cooked well but everything else tasted really fresh and good.
Would recommend this place and go there again for sure!

Variety 4,5/5
Ambience 3,5/5
Price 4/5
Quality 4/5

See you soon!
author: Christian D.

description:
My FAVORITE Mexican food joint in the city. This food is that fabulous combo of fresh and heavy/greasy that I love. Example: I like to get the 2-piece combo with pork tacos. The meat is super flavorful and topped with onion/cilantro mix. The rice is simple and delicious. Each dish comes with a nice mix of tomato/lettuce. The salsa is so fresh and yummy! It's cash only but super cheap. Like $20 later and you have a very filling meal for two-cheap. Classic hole-in-the-wall vibe. Love the wood panel walls and green paint :) Very clean though! Service is fantastic. Quick, super friendly and just a pleasure! 

TLDR: No frills. Quick/delicious food. Cash only.
author: Amy C.

description:
Was in the city with my nieces and they are the pickiest people to figure out where to get to lunch at, one is 10, other is 16 so I stopped giving suggestions and just said hey I'm not into going to McDonald or Burger King, so let's figure something out, they both said with let's get Mexican food, well hot damn we have a goal.

Whipped out my Yelp App to look up what was in our area and less the mile away was Olivo's, after checking out the reviews & photos this looked like the place we were headed to. 

We got there found a table and checked out the menu. The 10 year old ordered a bean and cheese burrito and French fries, hey it's what she wanted, it keep her happy and I was the cool aunt for getting it for her haha. The 16 year old ordered 3 carne asada taco combo came with beans & rice. I ordered 2 carne asada tacos & a carne asada tostada combo with beans and rice. We all ordered a soda, it comes in bottle or can.

The 10 year olds food was gone before I knew it, and the 16 year old even put her phone down to get up her plate. My tacos & tostada was delsh, the meat was seasoned perfectly, and avocado was fresh, this was a great lunchtime meal

This is a cash only place, so if that bothers you, then go somewhere else, just know you will be missing out on some great food.  For our lunch it was 29 bucks! That right there is a banging deal! Service was fast and friendly too!

If in the area, give Olivo's a try
author: Monica O.

description: I'd give them a 0 star review but you can't. Arrived 10 min to 7pm after walking for blocks and then told "we are not serving for eat in". I'm from out of town where do I take my food? The reviews about the girl behind the counter are not wrong. Attitude up the wazoo for no reason. Skip this place.
author: Rozy G.

description:
This place is definitely a hole-in-the-wall (which I like) in the outskirts of the TL (maybe not as nice). I went to the restroom first when I got here to wash my hands and it is for sure a hole-in-the-wall bathroom. Dirty, out of soap, and out of paper towels. Wasn't a good start to the meal.

But then my food came and everything changed. Split the carne asada fries and was not disappointed. Came with ample amount of cheese, guacamole (heaps of the good stuff), steak, jalapeños, cilantro. We devoured it. With just that, I thought I would give it 4 stars. But then my main entree came, the "arroz con mariscos" which was rice with seafood (shrimp, calamari, sole filet) and four small fried plantains. This blew me away. Flavor was spot on; seafood was generous (seriously, heaps of shrimp, fish, and calamari); rice was cooked to perfection (not too wet, not dry); great balance of salty and sweet (the plantains). Ever been on the search for the perfect seafood paella? I have...even in Spain...but can say that I have usually been disappointed; there's usually not enough seafood, or the rice is dry, or something. The arroz con mariscos was like that...only it did not disappoint at all...and it's not paella....but it was the perfect combination of rice and seafood. 

Table also came with free chips and salsa, and pickled cabbage, which was a perfect crispiness for my dish. I'm coming back. But I'll wash my hands before I get there. 

Five stars. And a request soap and paper towels in the bathroom =)
author: Will H.

description: Bought a carne asada super burrito. Meat was good, but way too much rice and beans. More meat would be awesome.
author: Zenas S.

description: Pretty weak, I know there is a lack of Mexican food around this area but I live a block away and won't ever go back.
author: Tyson C.

description: Pupusas were good but very overpriced. Also this place only accepts cash, its 2017 come on !
author: Chris G.

description:
Service/ Ambience: free chips and salsa even when you order takeout. The place is on the smaller side but the service is great.

Food:
-Papusas are amazing and comboing them with the cabbage salad they provide makes it bomb.com

-Steak w/ Garlic Shrimp is my personal go to. The portions are huge so you can definitely split it up into two meals. The shrimp was very flavorful and the steak (carne asada meat) was very juicy and flavorful as well. In this combination dish the rice and the beans are also good.

-Chicken Quesadilla is pretty good as well with the tortilla perfectly toasted and the cheese being perfectly melted.

Overall, the food is great, the service is good, and honestly I moved to SF recently and gave into the hype of El Farolito (they are good but a little far for me). If you live in the Lower Nob Hill area, don't bother driving and give this place a shot because they will not disappoint.
author: Edward C.

description: My favorite spot in SF for pupusas. Charming, quaint, great music. Kind of a hole-in-the-wall/dive bar feel, but seriously great food. Great salsa too!
author: Kate P.

description:
This is one of those under-the-radar Mexican-Salvadorean restaurants peppering our ethnically diverse city, and I keep stumbling upon them. OK, 'stumbling' is not the right word because I'm always seeking out menudo. My tripe obsession needs to stop, but I continue on my quest in the wilds of the Tenderloin. OK, it's not that wild on this stretch of Larkin, just a little gamey if you know what I mean. Funny thing is I've discovered all sorts of meals in the vicinity - Little Henry's Italian Food, Aria Korean American Snack Bar, Yemeni's - not all great but interesting culinary adventures.

Anyway, I came here with the hope of menudo, but alas, it was not meant to be as I was there on a Monday evening, and they weren't willing to gather some bone scraps for me. Instead, I went for the large $8.99 bowl of Caldo de Res, beef soup to all you monolingual peons, and while not quite as chewy as a satisfying bowl of menudo, it came close with big chunks of tender beef and vegetables (including chayote) treading in a hearty broth (photo: http://bit.ly/17wJ3j5). It was deliciously rural, especially with a stack of warm tortillas (photo: http://bit.ly/16TEL3e).

I made a futile attempt at putting together makeshift beef tacos, but the back splash was too much for my shirt to bear. Thinking the soup was not going to be enough, I also ordered a couple of the $4.99 Carnitas Soft Tacos, which were liberally topped with chunks of roast pork, chopped onion and cilantro (photo: http://bit.ly/1bVbACq). Good but not quite as good as the soup, and frankly I was getting filled up at that point. The service was a bit spotty as it took quite a while before they recognized I was going to be a paying customer. Oh well, I'll shout next time like the snaggle-toothed guy with the shopping cart outside.

FOOD - 4 stars...the beef soup is great on a wintry evening, the carnitas tacos just pretty good
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...typical Tenderloin diner set-up
SERVICE - 3 stars...slow at first but picked up once the food came
TOTAL - 4 stars...I'll probably come back for the menudo...I can't help myself
author: Ed U.

description:
AMAZING PUPUSAS here!!! I like it! I came here for lunch while walking on Larkin Street and was craving for pupusas. Fortunately, the service for ordering food and getting a table to sit at was quick. This is my second time trying out pupusas in SF, and so far I'm still a fan. 
I ended up ordering 2 pupusas (~ $5.99) and horchata (~ $ 2-3). The horchata is house made and tasted refreshing with the right amount of sweetness. The server gave me free chips & salsa, too, which is nice. Overall, the meal was pretty tasty. 
If you're close by on Larkin or NobHill area, check this place out for an inexpensive and delicious quick meal. I might try out their fish tacos and burrito next time.
author: Vivian L.

description: Killer wet burrito! Red or green sauce. This is the only thing I come here for. Aside from the food. Liz is awesome! Cheers Liz!
author: Miguel Y.

description:
Don't judge this 'book' by its cover... the food is amazing; trust. Doesn't look like much but the Mexican slash Salvadorean food here is really really good. It's basic AF and that's exactly why it's perfect. Staff is very friendly and don't be ordering a Corona; go with the Regia Extra... so good. 
As far as what to order... I've had almost everything on the menu and it's all good. Go explore and be happy. Cheers
author: Chuck R.

description:
It's not always easy to find a solid burrito but Olivo's delivers. 

For under $9 you can get a burrito almost the size of your forearm. The tastiness factor is high, ingredients are good, and the folks that work here are nice. 

I'd definitely walk the extra blocks to come here over Pancho's on Polk (bleech).
author: Rachel R.

description: This was a pleasant surprise! This is a budget place but food was really well made and great taste. This is a cash only and self service place (order in bar and pay in bar) so don't expect much, but staff was still nice.
author: Björn R.

description: The pupusas are good! We (a group of 4) waited about 35-40 minutes for our 8 to-go pupusas, so it's best to call ahead! The pupusa with chicharron y queso is my favorite - it definitely had more cheese than chicharron in it but was still delicious. We were too far from the Mission to get pupusas there, but this was a good alternative since we were really craving them. Yes, the customer service could use some help; however, the one woman helping everyone had wayyy too much on her plate. She was taking orders on the phone, hostessing, serving food to everyone at the restaurant, busing and helping prepare all the to-go orders. We kindly asked for cups of water and the woman rolled her eyes at us and told us it would be extra charge which is fine, but they should consider having a jug of water and an area for people to pick out their utensils and napkins for the to go orders. The place seemed a bit stingy, so I'm not sure if they'd consider doing that. Overall, the pupusas get the 4/5 stars in this review. Hoping the owners can staff someone to help the woman on busy nights.
author: Fern S.

description: All of the food we had was amazing. Fresh and authentic. Loved the pupusas and platanos Fritos.
author: Scott P.

description: Although food was good the host was terrible. She provided terrible service and attitude. I would never want to eat here due to how rude she was.
author: Karina S.

description: Food was extremely good, and very reasonably priced. The lady (owner, I'm assuming) was friendly and had a great sense of humor. Cash only was kind of a drag but totally worth the hassle for such bomb food. I will definitely be back if I'm in town!
author: Shane H.

description:
Best food in the tenderloin hands down - shrimp burrito is the best on the planet ... For those who
Keep referring to it as a "Mexican" joint - sad to be so ignorant - how can you judge a food if you don't even know it's country of origin ? And as for the "rude" staff - they are all a family and are the kindest most helpful people ... From them you get what you give soooooooo.............guess they are rude to those who deserve it . 
Amazing food, amazing people... Period.
P.s. ( it's not Mexican food)
author: Celena E.

description:
Had their bisteck con papitas & tried their 2 pupusas (loroco con queso and queso). Came here with my family while on vacation after reading great reviews.

Came hungry,  left stuffed! Very friendly & made sure our party was not lacking anything. Small place,  but good food!
author: Amri P.

description: Stumbled upon this place walking through town. By far the best place I've ever eaten in San Francisco. It is my first place eating in San Francisco,  but seriously it's really good. Hot salsa is phenomenal,  just put it on what ever you eat!!
author: Sean C.

description: Go to this place if you miss your friend's mom's home cooking. Food here is delightful. I enjoy the papusas in particular. :)
author: Lainey D.

description:
I have one recommendation for this medium sized taqueria - The horchata is done right, a very unique style, it has a mochi like flavor to it and the ice  crumbles around the edges, giving some gulps a slushy like mouth feel. The rice is the star of this drink whereas others choose to highlight the cinnamon, this recipe almost tated like it was ommitted, and was good enough for me to order another one to go. 

But why did you come here? What did you want to know about. Thats right... pupusas. These, along with the burritos, are extremely reasonably priced for this side of town. Im talking two XL pupusas with beans and rice for less than $8, now thats just insanity. 

The flavor was not that fulfilling, but it's a food you can crave sometimes. However,  for this meal, it was anything but a guilty pleasure.
author: Holden N.

description: Hidden gem! Lived around here for nearly 4 years, but finally made it in. It's affordable, beer is ice cold, and their yuca frita con chiccharron is delicious! If you like yuca fries, make sure to stop by!
author: David S.

description:
CASH ONLY.  Went here for the pupusas and carne asada fries.  

The carne asada fries were decent.  They give you a pretty big portion, but I wish they put a little more meat on them.  

The pupusas were good, but definitely not the best I've had.  They don't give you any sauce, just curtido.  The curtido didn't have too much flavor, but it still left me satisfied.  You can get 2 pupusas for about $5.  

Street, metered parking.  During the day, parking should be easy to find.  At night, you might have trouble finding parking.
author: Lisa G.

description:
I probably should've tried their popular carne asada fries. Instead, I had their two item combo (approx. $8 - a great value for the amount of food you get) and chose their chicken tostada and chicken enchilada - comes with rice and choice of beans. It was nice that the server got our order in before the large group next to us, so our food came out relatively quick. Even though the food looked enticing, the flavors were a bit bland to me. 

I was a disheartened that they charge 99 cents extra for more tortilla chips - perhaps they do this so folks don't camp out here to fill their bellies for near free.

As for ambiance, the lighting in the sparce dining room is a bit harsh - flourescent...they do have a TV to keep you entertained.
author: Cathy K.

description: I've been here a few times now. I have had the carnitas super burrito, carne asada super burrito, carnitas quesadilla, and the breakfast burrito. They have all been consistently excellent. The carnitas super burrito with black beans no guac and no hot salsa is my go to now. They give salsa with the chips that I imagine is the hot salsa in the burrito, but I like to apply that myself. The salsa is also amazing!!! I can't recommend this place enough, and it's run by what I assume are family members. I tip them well and I hope you will do the same. The food is incredible, the service is great, and with all the fancy expensive places popping up I hope they can stay in business. You won't be disappointed!!!
author: Angelo P.

description: This is an amazing place. The food has an authentic taste To Mexican and Salvadorean food. The SUPER burrito with carne asada is incredible. The salsa is so tasty and spicy. I recommend anybody to come and eat here. The service is really good as well.
author: Faustino F.

description: My wife and I have been going here for about 5 years and we love it.  The family who run it are great and so is the food.
author: Hassan A.

description:
I got a huge burrito for something like $7.5, including a serving of corn chips and salsa.

It's not the cleanest nor the biggest place: there's some boxes on the floor next to the two small tables they have, and the ATM is placed kind of haphazardly at the entrance. But at those prices I don't think you can expect anything different.
They've got a TV going, showing Spanish/European soccer and they have cold Coronas in the fridge.

The lady behind the counter was very nice and the burrito was muy bueno :)
author: Malthe J.

description: I hardly write reviews. I lost my wallet here and the owners kept it safe for me until I realized the next morning. I might be biased from this experience, but their integrity goes to show their commitment to customer service. Also my go to is their California chicken burrito. Never disappointed, perfect tortilla and fried on the spot fries. Perfect for the pre-bar trivia night! Seriously though, I love that burrito even if my wallet went missing!
author: Narita  L.

description:
Cheap, tasty and a lot of food! 
The gentleman taking our order was very friendly too. Only thing I could say is
 -more sauce to the people!! Otherwise really nice!
Will be coming back as soon as I need my burrito fix.
author: Eric A.

description: Great vibe- opt to dine in or take out. Fresh salsa and chips served. I could literally see the team in the back chopping fresh veggies and slicing fresh steak. My food came back HOT and ready to devour! All the flavors were well balanced, considering visiting one more time before I leave SF. Really a great Salvadoran - style treat!
author: D L.

description: Very good authentic food! I was a little worried I came into this place not knowing anything about it but wasn't disappointed! Highly recommended!!
author: Jacob H.

description: I love this resturant  the food is great!
author: Elizabeth G.

description: This place is the best. I always come here and get the steak super burritos. It's huge, cheap, and delicious. Especially the rice in the burrito.
author: Kevin J.

description: Very generous portions (we've never seen such a huge burrito before). Beef soup was amazing - great broth (very good for your gut!), full of beef and vegetables, burrito was very tasty too. This place is very local, so do not expect much from the interior design, but you fill for sure be amazed by the flavours!
author: Anna G.

description:
Came here because the pictures of the carne asada fries looked amazing.  I was not disappoint.  

Thick fat fries that were hot and fresh out the fryer and super crispy, covered in real cheese and steak and goodness. 

Pupusas are pretty decent too, and I was quite happy that they provided chips and salsa.  

service ain't great but come on, this isn't some fancy pancy restaurant.  Same level of service you'd expect from an Asian restaurant which I'm perfectly fine with.
author: Tu T.

description:
Solid choice for mexican without having to go to the mission. A super burrito with the works is only $8.50. That's less than what I normally pay for a box of lettuce in the FiDi. I agree with other reviewers that the staff weren't too warm or anything but it's takeout so I don't really care.

Cash only. Next time I would get no rice though. Theirs is very fluffy and pretty tasteless. The burrito itself is big, they really don't need that as a filler. I lived in San Diego for years and this will keep my burrito cravings at bay until I visit again.
author: Emily H.

description:
Meh. Maybe would go back. 

The host/owner was very friendly, but offered no recommendations. She just kept saying it was all good, which frustrates me. The food didn't take long. I ordered pork chile verde and my partner ordered pollo something. My chile verde pork was well cooked and tender, but his chicken was very poor cuts of meat, greasy and fatty. The pork didn't have much flavor, just salty. Giving three starts bc the salsa was delicious (even with bagged chips) and the price was right.
author: James H.

description:
Probably the best Hispanic food you can get in the Tenderloin area of SF. 

Their ingredients are always fresh and I can expect to receive exactly what I want every time I order.

The staff and owners are super nice. It says a lot about a place when you see the owners physically working at their restaurant. 

This place is tucked away and easily gone by without notice. Right on Larkin next door to a small laundromat there lies Olivio's.

Cash only establishment never expect to pay more than $11 for a generous portion meal.

The chili relleno is one of my favorites and fills me up every time. The veggie burrito is incredibly fresh tasting and their black beans are always on point. 

It's cheap, great tasting food, great service need one really say more?
author: Kate D.

description: Two papusas (1 bean & cheese, one cheese and lorroco), beans and rice for $7.50?!!  yes, please.  Service was fast and friendly.  Food was so delicious I can't believe i haven't discovered this place sooner!
author: Jennifer L.

description: This place is super good. Best bang for your buck. Everything here is fresh and tasty. Super burrito for the win!
author: Nick K.

description:
I LOVE OLIVO'S!!!  I live around the corner and I have to fight the urge to eat there several times a week.  My favorites are:

1.  super burrito with chicken and black beans:  the guacamole they put on it is amazing and I have to stop myself from trying to eat the whole burrito in one sitting
2.  cheese pupusas: so good and the rice that comes with it is really flavorful
3.  chicken noodle soup:  I am a big fan of pho but when I have a cold or flu  the chicken noodle soup is the best comfort EVER.

Everyone that works there is really nice and the service is great.  There are a lot of burritos in the city but if I ever moved out of the TL I would still go back to get Olivos.
author: Windy M.

description: Pretty good. Sizable portions, tasty. Nice people. Meals around $10, plus or minus  couple dollars. Good value for the money. Most assuredly will return.
author: G M.

description:
We had the carnes asada fries and two puposas for the table. I then had the carnitas super burrito (basically with everything). The meal is cheap and delicious and super filling. I ended up taking the burrito to go because if I had eaten it there, i wouldn't have been able to move for at least two hours.

I will be back!
author: Andrew K.

description:
I'm not always in the mood to trek to the Mission and Olivos is a solid option. So far everything I've had has been great, or at least very tasty. 

The carne asada fries are great hangover food (not that I would know anything about hangovers). Burritos are great, I've tried 'em all. Love the pupusas.  Generous portions, good prices.

As for the service - I give five stars. Friendly and smiles all around! This is one of the few places that I go to regularly where they actually recognize me, even if I haven't been around in a long time.
author: Hayesvalleygirl ..

description:
This is a tiny Mexican-Salvadoran place in the tenderloin.  I discovered this because of a tip from a hotel bell hop who told me that even if they claim not to they will make a pupusa revuelta even if they may not say it on the menu.

yes..I have had better, but the friendly owners and the reasonably well made fillings are always fairly toothsome...and somehow it always happens to be slightly chilly when I make my way there...which may be biasing me a bit more. The pupusas are made to order and with a gently prodding they will make them browner on the outside and do a simple garlic and cheese filling if you want along with the bean and chicharron one!  Oh..I recently discovered that they made some crazy version of chilli fries by putting a carne asada and cheese on the fries.  i have tried them twice and the fries by themselves are always nice a crispy...but the carne asada has been great once and ehnn on a recent trip.  Perhaps the thing to do is to walk in with cold beer in a sack and eat the fries...maybe that will make them good all the time.

No need to go out of your way to go here...but if you are doing a divey eating tour of the tenderloin...do put this spot on your list.
author: Sunay P.

description:
I have a love-hate relationship with Olivo's. By far the best breakfast burrito within reasonable/safe walking distance from my apt.  It's delicious, but specify what you do/don't want, sometimes I feel like they throw in whatever they have that day.  They do it right though, perfect late-night next morning food.

The cons - 
1. The chips are not made in house and thus semi-stale tasting.  My suggestion would be to swing by Pacho's and get chips there if you're craving the food/chip combination.  

2. If you're ordering a combination meal, do not get it to go! Your taco, enchilada, and tamale are thrown into one takeaway dish, and honestly, by the time you get home, you will not be able to tell one from the other.

3. Service - I understand I'm not at GD's, I also get that most people take food to go, but the friendliness rating is really low. 

Other than that, the food is great and I look forward to venturing out of the bfast burrito category.
author: Brianna M.

description:
This place is a HUGE BUMMER. 

It's right across the street from my house, and the food is pretty damn good, but the service isn't just bad, it's HORRIBLE. 
I can usually overlook poor service if the food is good enough, but this is just ridiculous. 
I don't know what these people are doing in the service industry when they clearly hate every human being. 
Obvious dirty looks, scowls, and eye rolling every time. Seat yourself, get up to ask for water and refills, get up and get your own menu, get up to order... The women working at this place are not to be bothered with doing their job.
Oh well. Olivo's, what a shame. You are dead to me.
author: Brit F.

description:
Hands down the best burrito I've tasted in the city. It is a simple burrito with amazing flavor. One of the differences between traditional Mexican and El Salvadoran, aside from yummy delicious pupusas, is the use of saffron in their rice instead of tomato. This imparts a fragrance lacking in most burritos. Also Olivos nails the char flavored meat with perfect seasoning... Tastes like it came right off the wood-fired BBQ. 

The size is large and the price is right. The reason it got docked a star is because they only take cash and have an atm machine to dispense it in case you forgot to bring yours. I hate these machines... They charge $2.50-$5.00 and then the bank charges another $2... A very high price to pay for not having cash...  I wish the owners understood that it would just be better to get a merchant processing account and charge us for for the fee...  Btw, the courts recently ruled this is allowable.
author: Kane M.

description:
Aye Dios mío. 

Friendly mama at the counter, fresh salsa and chips, and a burrito the size of my leg. You'll fancy this joint. 

Support local San Franciscans, not chipotle.
author: Nick T.

description:
Not a fan for me and my sister. We ordered 2 burritos: pollo asado burrito with black beans and California burrito. The carne asada in the California burrito is ok. Too much of the fatty pork in it. Some became crispy though, which is better. The fries inside the burrito was not crispy at all, so not our favorite burrito. As for the other burrito, we could smell the pork grease in it. I think they re-used the pan to cook the pollo asado after cooking the carne asada. Also, not a big fan. 
I give a star for the nice and friendly staff :)
I give a star for the 2 bags of free chips and salsa. The salsa is so good and spicy. Mm
Plus another star for the price. Only $6.50 for a burrito.
author: Ervi L.

description:
I wouldn't go back. Chips are from some store bought bag and otherwise the flavors are completely uninspired. Their Tamarindo is quite tasty,  though.

Also, they only take cash.
author: Joseph J.

description: Great place for El Salvadorian food in the Loin.
author: Michael B.

description: This place is hands down my favorite place to get Cali burritos! It only cost around $7 which is the cheapest you'll find around the city. I usually just order to go but there are chairs and tables where you can eat and also a bathroom.
author: Raven M.

description:
The food is yummy,  the service is horrible. 

I would just like to make this clear, the staff is totally capable of great service! It is just completely conditional and based on whether or not you appear to be a big tipper (I guess). Although my friend and I arrived there first, our waitress took the order of a table of hip thirty-somethings, all the while laughing and suggesting items from the menu. When she got to our table her smile was gone, her mood had shifted, and we realized we must of looked hella poor. My friend and I laughed about this and talked (what must have been loudly) about the fact that there was an obvious difference in service. Long story short she must have herd because she was in a much better mood after! 
So all is well that ends well!
author: Shelbie B.

description: This place is incredible. The food is ridiculously good and inexpensive. The boyfriend and I will be regulars here.
author: Carolyn M.

description: Super good secret little restaurant in SF. Very flavorful carnitas. Good service and even better price- $7.50 for a super burrito! Insane! Definitely a must go in SF.
author: Patrick L.

description:
Whats up with the hostile, mean ugly staff?  

Not worth the the bad vibes.
author: Eric S. R.

description: I was lost one day and stumbled into the wonderfulness that is Olivo's. Great food and super sweet staff! Cash only, but do not worry because they have an ATM inside.
author: Dana M.

description:
Come here for the huge portions and GOOOOOD Salvadorian/Mexican food, NOT the ambiance.

The 4 stars are for the delicious ingredients and big portions. You'll end up feeling STUFFED. I ordered an all meat chicken burrito w/guacamole on the side and I seriously savored EVERY bite. The meat was so deliciously seasoned and grilled. The burrito comes with beans, rice, sour cream, and cheese. 

I want to try other items on the menu the next time I venture out to SF. The area is somewhat old and ghetto, but if you appreciate mom & pop restaurants, you'll enjoy your meal here.


CASH ONLY!!!
author: Juliet Rachel C.

description: Love this little hole in the wall. A whole lot of food for very little money. Be adventurous with your order, it's all good. Cash only but there is an ATM inside. Street is unlit and a little sketchy at night, so don't come walking here later in the evening if you look like an easy target. Be warned, friendly neighborhood crackheads will stick their faces against the glass and yell for money, but ignore them. They mean well. Good place to bring a few friends for too much food, cheap beers and friendly people.
author: Taylor B.

description: Great little secret in San Francisco! Super Burrito was fantastic! Carne Asada Fries were stellar! Really great salsa made fresh daily. Truly never had any burrito quite like it. Awesome!
author: Jerry E.

description:
My friend really wanted carne asada fries. After some Yelping, she found Olivo's. The only other place where I've had carne asada fries was Rigoberto's in San Diego. Olivo's fries were alright, but I prefer Rigoberto's. 

When we walked in, the waitress was pretty rude to us. She didn't even acknowledge us. After we seated ourselves, she walked over and her attitude completely changed. She was now smiling and being very polite. I can understand why she was rude in the beginning since she was the only waitress working and the restaurant was packed. We ordered the carne asada fries and soft shell fish tacos. The portion of fries was huge! They were topped with guacamole, ooey gooey cheese, jalapenos, onions, sour cream, and of course, carne asada! Only downside: the fries were pretty greasy. I'm guessing they are freshly made on site. The fish tacos weren't bad. I believe they used tilapia and sauteed it with onions and red bell peppers. They each come with huge slices of avocado, too! 

Overall, the food was decent and the employees are really nice. The waitress was really bogged down so the chef ended up bringing my tacos out and he was really nice too. We waited a pretty long time for our orders to be taken and again for our food to come out, but it was lunch time so it was understandable. The waitress apologized multiple times for the wait, which I really appreciated. 3.5 stars! If I do come back in the future, I'd love to try the pupusas since Yelpers have raved about them.

Btw, cash only. We only noticed after we sat down, and by then it would have been rude to leave. Luckily, I had some cash on me!!
author: Audrey T.

description: They have one of the best Pupusas in town. It us a little hole in the wall but the food is surprisingly five stars :)
author: Karla D.

description:
A decent Salvadoran/Mexican option in the Asian-heavy Larkin restaurant row. 

I've only had pupusas at one other place-- Balompie-- and those were much better than Olivo's. Still, they were tasty and cheap. 

I also tried a couple of tacos, carne asada and chile verde. They were 3-star A-OK. Nothing to write home about. 

I don't know why the other Yelpers seem to have such problems with the service here; I found everyone to be quite friendly. 

But in a city full of above-average Mexican options, I fear I shan't be returning to Olivo's anytime soon. I certainly don't regret trying it, though.
author: Brett W.

description:
The pupusas are good ( order pork and cheese yum!) and the yuca with chicarrones is so delish as well.

remember is cash only
author: Fran M.

description:
I just got back from San Diego last weekend, and ever since experiencing my first California Burrito, I had to have it again. Apparently it's only a San Diego thing though. Until now. I did a little Yelp research on California Burritos in the Bay area. I came across this little gem, and to my surprise it was just 5 blocks from me. How did I not know about this?!

The burrito was absolutely spot on comparable with the ones they have in San Diego. They also offer the famous Carne Asada fries here too. French Fries and Mexican food together just FIT. It's miraculous.

I plan to get my San Diego friend to visit me here soon and see for himself. No more trips to the sketchy, dirty Mission for me (sorry if that offends you)! I have all I need in a Mexican restaurant RIGHT HERE! Yum.
author: Ashley D.

description: It's good.  It's inexpensive.  They are quick but not so fast that you know the food has all been sitting there, they are actually making it.  The girl who usually works the front is very nice :)  You can call in orders.
author: McKenzie M.

description: I love this place because it delivers exactly what I'd hoped for. Two pupusa with beans and rice, curtido (pickled cabbage) and salsa for about eight bucks. And the food was delicious, I can't wait to go back there. You also get chips and salsa with your meal!
author: Amaresh S.

description:
Quesadillas are amazing, burrito maybe not so much. I only ordered the 2-item combo though. Maybe should have gotten something else? 
Meal came with rice and beans, lettuce, chips and salsa. Worth it, imo.
author: Clara H.

description: I'm a proud salvadoreño and I did not appreciate the fact that the people here say they serve the food from my country. I ordered two pupusas revueltas. This means. Beans. Chees. And pork. All I got is chees. And a pinch of pork. customer service was horrible. I re - ordered the two pupusas. And specifically asked for all three ingredients.  And I got a pupusa full of beans. I can say I'm never eating here again.
author: Hershey R.

description:
Awesome little hole in the wall serving up some Salvadorian dishes. While not in the cleanest part of the city- the restaurant itself clean, simple and spacious- doesn't look like it but when you step in you actually see they have lots of seating in the back. 

Their menu runs 4 pages front and back filled with Americanized items like the California burrito (a burrito with freakin' FRIES inside.... be horrified or delighted) to made fresh Pupusas. 

Came here to try the pupusas since it's on this 7X7 Best 20 Dishes Under $10 List
http://www.7x7.com/eat-drink/20-best-dishes-under-10-tenderloin-tendernob

Amazing deal you get your choices of 2 pupusas (comes with pickled slaw and spicy salsa) for only $4.50!! They have 4 choices: 
1. Cheese
2. Cheese & Fried Pork
3. Cheese & beans
4. Cheese & Loroco ("vine flower" according to the menu)

I got the fried pork- it was Mmmmmmmmm delicioso. The Loroco was also very tasty and unique. 

Service was great- the lady who took our orders was very nice.
author: Eva H.

description:
Pupusas: black bean and cheese with the house salsa was DELICIOUS.
Service: disinterested and forgetful.
Bathroom: very dirty.

I tried the cheese and loroco pupusa but the flower taste was strange and overwhelmed the pupusa. My mistake in ordering it. Also, I tried the chicken soup. The broth was oddly yellow (maybe they used a lot of chicken bouillon to make it) and the soup may have had the loroco in it because there was a similar strange and overpowering flowery taste to it. I scavenged the chicken from the soup to stuff in my pupusa. 

I had high hopes for Olivo's but may have ordered poorly. My boyfriend had the California burrito and thought it was okay.
author: Ali B.

description:
Hard one to write, I have mixed feelings. Been putting it off but here it goes - I have been coming since this place opened. Was super excited to have some Pupusas in the neighborhood. I'm glad Olivo's seems to be doing well, I imagine the family has busted much butt, and I am really glad they've remained open and running in the pit hole block they are on. Really, no one does well in this location, you have to stand out.

I'm there less frequently lately (well the past year) for a reason. The quality is going downhill. Upon the their grand opening, it would take a little while to get Pupusas out but I honestly think it was because it was done with a lot more care - I assume high standards for the food were set. I won't speculate why, but it just seems like that has changed. The food is still good, they need to stay around.

This location has seen way too many small eateries fail. Olivo's has held strong and has gained loyalty, They dont need to be perfect - but I wish they'd show a little more welcome to customers and make the food super awesome again. I'm rooting for them nonetheless, why I gotta be honest.
author: Teri A.

description:
This was the only place my husband and I did not like on our vacation in SF. The waitress/hostess was BEYOND RUDE. The place was completely empty besides one guy at the bar who already had food. She acted like it was killing her to serve us and was not interested in smiling at us, wanting to help with questions we had or anything. If I was the owner of this place, I would be ashamed of this girl. I wish I got her name.

The food was not great at all which made being here even worse. I wish we would have left the second we walked in. Mexican food places to me have standards when it comes to their chips and these ones were just awful. Stale and overall crappy. AND I PAID FOR THEM!!!!!!! Ridiculous. I would never go back here. Our food took a long time to come out and I was not impressed at all. Charge too much for food that is not great and the horrible service we experienced made it an awful time.
author: Rebekah S.

description: Olivo's is definitely not located in the best neighborhood and I would not recommend eating in, but this is my new go-to burrito place. I got the California burrito (french fries inside the burrito), which was INCREDIBLE. The burrito was the size of my thigh, I could not even finish half of it!
author: Peggy L.

description: Excellent lunch! Very tasty and filling...great service too! I had the two item combo, two enchiladas beef and pork. Also had chips and guacamole which was freshly made as were tge tortillas. Yumm!
author: Steven H.

description: So delicious every time. Call ahead in the lunch hour. Chile verde is sooo good. Service quick. Not much dinero either!
author: Laura P.

description:
Totally whatevers.  

I was on the lookout for some deliciously stacked, gooey carne asada fries here in norcal and wasn't able to find any.  Lo' an behold, my friends told me they had gotten some of these forsaken fries in the City so the first thing on my checklist was to try them out.  Verdict?  WHATEVERS.

Maybe I'm used to socal's pound of fries slathered in thick guacamole, cheddar cheese, spicy salsa, cut-up onions, refried beans, creamy sour cream... but seriously? Seriously?  You call that carne asada fries?  It's an insult to one of CA's best Mex-American foods!  It's like the super small, classier (andy by classier I mean, less portions cuz you know how those fancy restaurants do it), won't fill you up version that you possibly might want to eat with a date (no date I'm gonna go on mind you).  I was craving those HUGE, heavy, eat til you drop until all that's left are mushed up ingredients that probably look very similar to what's already in your stomach.  For $6.99, I could very well get quadruple of what I got down there down in socal.  

My friend and I got the pupusas as well because they were a completely different color (light blue) from the rest of the Christmas color coded menu.  If there's something on the menu that is a different color from the rest, obviously it's highlighted for a reason, amirite?  Don't be fooled.  I ordered the cheese and pork pupusa and the bean and cheese pupusa.  My friend ordered the loroco (vegetable) and cheese.  If you've never had pupusas, they come with a little salad/radish mixture to top off the pupusas.  The pupusas were good on their own but they were nothing like the ones in the hood of eastbay where the owner didn't speak a lick of English, which means you know it's good.  The salad was missing that vinegary kick so we ended up dousing our pupusas in tapatio to get it down our throats.  

All in all, I say save your money and go somewhere else for your carne asada fries and pupusas.
author: Tori Q.

description: I always come here for their pupusa plates when I'm in the neighborhood, and even after all these years, their prices have remained affordable without compromising on the  quality and quantity of the food. Great portions, tasty pupusas, and a free round of chips and salsa!
author: Jessica L.

description:
Came here just for the Carne Asada fries and it feels much like SoCal.

I'll have to go back for the California Burrito, another SoCal favorite.

I'm not quite sure if I went at a slow time, but they literally sliced the potato when I ordered.  The guacamole was also made right when I ordered so I know I didn't have food that was just lying around.

Their menu looks quite extensive so I know I'll be coming back for more!
author: Jason K.

description: Really filling meal at good prices. The Papusa was great. I liked the cheese and pork much more than the cheese and lorocco or whatever it's called. I'd pass on the beans and rice too. I deducted a star for the waitress who was the master of sass (not the good kind)
author: David L.

description: Sketch neighborhood. Lots of hookers. But the staff are friendly and the food is delish.
author: Heather L.

description:
This place is just a dump, I was so disappointed in it.  

The bathroom looked like something out of a horror movie.  It was pretty gross, and I'm not normally grossed out by bathrooms.  There's a bucket of filthy liquid with some old mop sticking out of it...  and you can imagine how that smelled.  Seriously I would recommend holding your pee in at all costs.  It's just not worth it.

"Service" was so terrible it was nearly comical.  To get a water, I had to get up and walk to the "server", ask for it, wait 10 minutes, get up and ask a 2nd time, then I finally got a water.  You can guess how refills went.

I had the California burrito with steak.  Worst burrito I've ever had, no exaggeration.  The beef in the burrito was gross.  It had weird nodules and chewy/crunchy bits that you had to spit out.  The burrito comes with no sides and I didn't even finish it.  

And finally, for your inconvenience, they don't take credit cards.
author: Stu R.

description:
OK I didn't like Olivo's without giving them a chance. I was sooo upset about my favorite Pho restaurant disappearing from the spot about 3 years ago (I used to eat their about twice a week)... 

Finally I gave it a try and I loved their food. I liked juiciness and crispiness of Carnitas the most. Oh they have one of the biggest buritos I ever seen... I will definitely go back soon.
author: Chie J.

description: I tried their popusas and they were pretty good! Their horchata was bomb too. I just hoped they would have had different types of salsa.
author: Nancy V.

description:
California burrito - delicious. The fries were like steak fries and were missing some salt, but salsa made up for it.

Definitely coming back when I get another craving for California burritos.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Not very authentic. The guacamole tasted store bought....as did the chips, rice and beans. The food was tasty but nothing special. 

The waitress was nice but had nothing to recommend to us as a specialty. 

Overall, I will not be going back, but I take Mexican food seriously. 

It's a good place for a quick, cheap meal.
author: Julie J.

description: Nacho fries are delicious . All our food was yummy ! Very generous portions ! Price is cheap for the amount of food we got! It's a hole in the wall but well worth giving it a shot!
author: Sandra G.

description:
Good pupusas in the TL.  This place has a really small family feel.  You can see the lady hand making your pupusas in the kitchen, while you chill at the counter with a corona, and catch up on Caso Cerrado on TeleMundo.  The fried plantains are also to die.
Cheap. Fast. Delicious... right up my alley
author: Jannea T.

description:
I've fallen a little in love with this place, and only wish I had discovered it sooner!!  The food is fresh and honest and SCRUMPTIOUS, the portions are HUMONGOUS, the prices VERY reasonable, and the family running it is very hard-working and nice.  

The pupusas are addictingly good (and wonderful left-over the next day) and the plantain is super-yummy, but my favorite dish (so far) has to be the fish tacos with their many pieces of flaky, buttery sole, fresh avocado, onion and grilled peppers.  Even the rice and beans are tasty (and I'm not a rice and beans type of person).  I have to admit I haven't had the nerve/appetite to order the carne asada fries yet but they look fabulous, and judging from the near-orgasmic sounds coming from the next table where two friends were sharing them, they taste even better!

Now a word for those mean people complaining about the "service":  this place is open 12 hours a day, six days a week, and I have a suspicion that some of the family members work the entire time.  The older woman behind the counter both times I went has a "Grumpy Cat" type of face, probably from a hard, tiring life and having to deal with the riff-raff in the neighborhood stumbling in and giving her a hard time (she has to put the tip jar behind the counter as there have been so many "grab and go" thefts from it).  But if you talk to her and are friendly, she is quite wonderful and helpful.  I'm not even sure they offer table service, because the regulars seem to know to order at the counter, sit down, eat your scrumptious meal, and then get up and go over to the counter and pay.  This is NOT the Ritz, "lack of service" complainers, it is a small and very good family-run restaurant in the Tenderloin, so please take your privileged and entitled butts somewhere else!!
author: Kathleen M.

description:
not a fan. Ashley J. loves the California burritos and I did not try them.

1. The place is dirty. I looked into the kitchen and it was not clean. I mean I decided to order a vegetarian burrito, due to my eyes seeing the kitchen.

2. The waitress was not really approachable. 

3. The atmosphere of this place is well very rustic.

4. did not want to see the bathroom.

6. Chips and salsa not good. 

If you like California burritos then I would say this is your place. Give it a try. Not my cup of tea.
author: Aneliese R.

description: Carne asada fries and the fish tacos were amazing. I definitely recommend! Employees were very sweet.
author: Darby B.

description:
Carne asada fries and california burrito! What?! In NorCal? Pretty awesome stuff. I try not to get this every time I go here, but I do! I just love French fries everything. I would say I've had better in SD, but this place isn't bad! Prob best in the city.

-1 star for the slow service.
author: Phuc N.

description: OMG the carne asada fries! Mmmmm sooo good! Also tried the carne asada burrito and 2 pupusas: cheese and beans/ cheese and pork. Everything was good!
author: Maria G.

description:
I'm going to begin this tale by saying I'm lactose intolerant. That being said, I find most Mexican restaurants tend to... How to put this.. Taste like cardboard dipped in salsa if there's no cheese on it. Olivo's, however, doesn't. 

My first time at any Mexican restaurant, I order a regular Carne asada burrito to gage it against a common mean. I often don't expect much. Olivo's prepared it extremely flavorfully. I was pleasantly surprised. I hardly noticed the salsa that subtly spiced the abundant amount of meat, which drove the flavor. 

The staff was friendly, the service fast, the prices cheap. 

Oh and the chips were crisp and fresh.
author: Stephen S.

description: Minus one star today. I had a pupusa craving (Of course, I did!). It was a weekend, so there was another woman, a larger, full-figured one, was working. I put in my order and told her I would go to the store and I would return. Upon my return, I offered to pay for my order. She said she couldn't accept it. AND PROCEEDED TO PLAY ON HER SMARTPHONE. Actually, I'll deduct one more star. And no tip for her!!!
author: Denzo A.

description:
I'm in love again. With french fries.

For the past couple of years, I've had a predominantly hate relationship with them. They added pimples to my face and inches to my waist. But I think I've finally forgiven and forgotten--or at least have reason to.

Because of OLIVO's CARNE ASADA FRIES! My friends and I came after our first law school exam to celebrate, and the food was so good I didn't even think about my prospects for failing. The fries were fresh, the carne asada was deliciously seasoned, and the layers of cheese, guacamole, and jalapenos melted in my too happy mouth. I dare say these fries are even better than the bacon cheese fries at Outback Steakhouse, which are now a distant second in my book. GASP.

We also had the grilled chicken and fried plantains as well as the green chili pork, both of which came with your choice of beans and hot tortillas. The grilled chicken was nicely browned, tender, flavorful and just perfect with the fried plantains. The green chili pork was super moist (think Hawaiian Kalua Pig) and had a small kick. I really enjoyed lunch here--the sluggish service did not hamper my orgasmic experience with the fries.

I can't wait to come again. Fries4life.
author: Liz T.

description: I'm org. from San Diego and have such a difficult time finding amazing carne asada fries. Once I found this place, I knew I could survive in SF. Amazing and the family who owns the place is super chill. Love their carne asada fries and Cali burrito!!
author: Erin M.

description:
The last two times I came here I got food poisoning. My date also got sick. Not cute...

There is no real reason why I would make this a destination spot even if i had not gotten sick...
save your money
author: Amanda S.

description: I am born and raised in the Tenderlion and Olivo's have great tacos and Pupusa. The service, is nice and very accommodating towards me and my husband and the food is great. My new spot to get my Salvadorian pupusas and my first love....the tacos!!!!!
author: Franny A.

description:
I have a feeling I'll be doing an update soon but for now : 4 stars.

First time got the 2 pupusas + 1/2 soup. Pupusas were fine. Nothing dramatic. Soup was a nice homemade chicken soup. I was craving latin food but getting a cold at the same time. Brilliant pairing.

Today I got a very decadent "California" burrito. No rice, no beans, just french fries! With the rest of the fillings that you'd expect in a burrito: meat, cheese, guac, sour cream. 

OK, basically a heart attack in a tortilla. But SO delicious.

Olivo's differs from most Mexican/Salvadoran in that they have an atypical menu. Atypical for Northen Cali Mexican food. I don't know if it's authentic or not but it sure tastes good.

What's especially amazing is their chips and salsa. I hate pico de gallo. Olivo's has a beautiful red salsa that's extremely delicious and their chips taste homemade. Fabulouso!

Prices are extremely reasonable and the service is very nice. A good family run place.
author: Yasi S.

description:
At first I was surprised to see that our favorite Vietnamese lunch spot had changed to a Mexican/Salvadorian restaurant, but after having eaten there today I am thrilled to have this wonderful new place within walking distance of my office!

They didn't change the decor from the previous ownership (read:  sparse atmosphere of a typical TL Vienamese restaurant), however the place is now VERY clean, which was a necessary improvement.

Olivos is family-owned and you are greeted warmly and personally - in our case by the son, then later by the father, Jose Guardado.

Our lunch was awesome, and so much food we took half of it home.  Go light on the chips & salsa and save room - you'll thank me.  

Pupusas - I nearly did a little dance upon seeing these on the menu,  I love them so!  We shared a cheese pupusa, and a pork & cheese pupusa as an appetizer.  If you don't know what these are, they're like a cornmeal pancake filled with meat &/or cheese - so delicious!  We were told that they are becoming "known" for their pupusas, and I can see why!
$3.50 for 2 salad-plate sized pupusas 

Menudo - I had to try this soup as I had been hearing about its restorative properties and had been wanting to taste it.  OH MY YUM.  Rich tangy broth with big chunks of tripe, no hominy.  Served with lime, chopped onions, and chile flakes.  My friend is Mexican and her mother used to make Menudo, so from her experience she can attest that it was excellent, too.  Pho, watch out, I have met Menudo and I love it! 
$6.95 for a bowl, 1/2 soup & 2 pupusa special for $7.95

Fish Tacos - HUGE PLATE - 2 fish tacos with a ton of fish, only slightly battered with cornmeal, so well cooked and spiced and not greasy.  The presentation was nice and the taste was delicious.  Served with beans (your choice of what kind) and rice. 
$9.95 for a huge portion

It's right across the street from Brick, and is the anti-Brick - big portions, not expensive, no atmosphere to speak of.  I like both for different reasons.

Run don't walk to check out this little gem of a restaurant.
author: Liz S.

description:
Like many from yelp, I made a trip to Olivio's for one goal.  Carne asada fries.. oily, greasy, delicious carne asada fries.  It's been a little over 10 years since I've had some so cal taco shop style carne asada fries, far too long.  Although the fries are not on the menu, Olivio's will make them for you if you ask.

Upon entering this fine establishment, guests will marvel at the wood paneling, and decorative Salvadorean items.  There is a bottle of Tapatio at each table and a variety of hanging plants.

Back to the food.  Unlike so cal carne asada fries, Olivio's offers a more reasonably sized portion (see my uploaded picture).  They also use a lot more cheese and less guacamole then what I remember from so cal.  What I really like is that their fries are not the frozen pre-made fries, Olivio's serves hand-cut potatoes fried with no batter.  Fantastic.

If the intense flavors of the cheese and the oil of the fries is too much, just grab the salsa they serve with the free chips and give your fries a good drizzle of salsa.  Perfect!  

It goes without saying I'll be back, it just depends on when.
author: Eric L.

description:
Like many of the previous posters have attested to, great burritos, terrible service...

I give it 3 stars, tops.  Would give it 5 if it weren't for this wretched gal who works here (but more on that later).

The burritos - probably my favorite in the city.  Saffron rice, the right amount of onion/cilantro, perfect beans, great meat.  They keep me coming back for more.  

The service - the one gal, probably in her early 30s and a tad bit on the plump side, is just plain rude and unfriendly.  I just don't get it... If you want to sell more burritos, just be more friendly! IT'S PRETTY FREAKING SIMPLE.  Every time I deal with her, she almost makes you feel like you are annoying her buy purchasing a burrito.

(Come on chick... life can't be that bad.  Smile, be friendly.  Heck, say "hello", or "thank you", or anything!!)

Let me remind you -- you work in the service industry.  Your job is to serve customers.  Get over it.  Or get a new job.

Her mom (I'm assuming) is actually a *bit* more friendly, but this attitude appears to run in the family...

Anyway, yes, I'll be back for more burritos.  And yes, I will continue to try to get you to lighten the f up and smile, (but I realize I will likely continue to fail miserably at that task...)

And Kathleen M, it's nice you are are so forgiving of the clear lack of general friendliness (that only helps one run a more successful business).  I, however, do not have much love or respect for people that seem to hate their job, act like they hate their customers, and those who begrudgingly take your money as if they are "entitled" to it.  Maybe you should apply for a job there to brighten up the atmosphere? :)

Also, just to clarify, they are not open 7 days a week, they are closed on Sunday.
author: Eric S.

description:
Really solid place, I went because I was desperate for some Chile Relleno and ended up going back to try other stuff on the menu.

Their Pupusas are amazing, true, I might have gained a few pounds from it, but I'm pretty hooked, I have constant cravings for it.  

Also, menudo is a great hangover stew.
author: Yingjue C.

description: Very little parking. Bad customer service, lady who took our order was rude and had a bad tone to her voice, sounds like she didn't even wan to take our order. Only 3 kind of meat style they had, pork beef and chicken, only grilled. Oh and yeah, check your food closely for the cooks hair. Found a strain of hair in my wife's plate. It's funny how people said they have the cheapest Cali burrito there, it's because you get what you pay for.
author: Tiger B.

description:
This is my favorite Mexican/Salvadorean restaurant in the neighborhood.  It's a casual, family-owned restaurant that serves excellent home-cooked meals.  The portions are HUGE, so you'll never go hungry. 

The meal starts off with complimentary salsa and chips.  Let me say, they serve THE BEST homemade salsa in the CITY!

The carne asada fries are considered appetizers, but it's a meal in itself.  You get a heap of fries with diced beef, cheese, guacamole, sour cream, cilantro, and jalapenos.   

For a lighter fare, the pork pupusas are perfect, and they come with vinegar coleslaw.  

Some of my favorite dinner plates: carne asada with fries; carne asada with cheese enchilada(warning, this comes with a lot of food); salvadoreno steak with bell peppers, tomatoes and onions;  pork chops with casamiento and plantains.  Casamiento (fried rice with black beans and onions) is considered a breakfast item in El Salvador, but I could eat this all day!  The plaintains are freaking awesome.  If I only had a pint of vanilla ice cream with it, it would be perfect!
  
Apparently, they tried various locations in the city and finally settled in our neighborhood.  Lucky us!  I hope they never, ever move!!!
author: Naomi N.

description:
I love dives! I was really hoping for a great discovery here. The woman at the counter ignored me (apparently her conversation couldn't be interrupted) and the guy had to come out of the back to give me a menu.

Carne asada super burrito to go - more like two cups of rice and some inedible meat fat in a warm tortilla.
