We had a choice of black, pinto or refried beans, so I assume there are vegan/vegetarian options.
To top it all of, our dinner, two meals, three beers was all less than $25.
And to make a long story short, the food, service and prices are all phenomenal. We have to try and make it back for their breakfast.
author: Tim J.

description: This place is amazing. Food is excellent and cheap. Its great for groups or you and another person. You have to get a regia which is a HUGE beer and the papusas.
author: Mike L.

description: legit california burritos in a city where there are only about 3 places that make them for some reason. i heard the pupusas are really legit as well. this place is straight mom and pop and i love it.  if you are in the tl and want a cali burrito. the decision has just been made for you
author: Matthew R.

description:
I got the pork and cheese pupusas with rice and black beans, along with a side of plantains and sour cream.  I really wanted to love it.  I liked it, but it really wasn't what I had expected.  The plantains were great.  The pupusas were much more bland than I expected.  I could barely taste the pork -- way more cheese than meat.  

It wasn't bad, but I probably wasn't impressed enough to go back.
author: Luke P.

description: The best Mexican food in Nob Hill by a wide margin.  You get sit down type Mexican family dinner at grab and go taqueria prices.  I got a combination plate and every item was good.  The chile relleno was cooked perfectly with great beans and rice.  Very flavorful.  This place also provides very good salsa which for me, is very important.  Definitely get a bottle of the Regia, it's a light corona type beer but comes in 32 ounce bottles, and it's very refreshing.  I went to Pancho's on Polk a week earlier and the difference is night and day.  Better portions, more selection, much better flavor, and better ambiance.  Pancho's, la mexicana, la parilla, sorry you lost all my business.
author: Tony S.

description: Dinner for 8 people who all leave full and happy from good food and tipsy from gigantic beers and carafes of wine and the bill is only $103?  Count me in for that!
author: Angela M.

description: Cheap yummy goodness... pupusas and carne asade fries. Yay!!!
author: Donna V.

description:
5 stars for cheese pupusas, rice and beans.  yummy yum.  

the cold, indifferent waitresses burn a hole through my soul.  so -2 stars for making me scared to ask them for a diet coke.
author: J.R. R.

description: Dayuuuuum does this place know how to serve up a Salvadoran breakfast!!!!  If you want to go to a nice place where you can lounge out, sip on mimosas and be prissy then this place aint for you buddy...BUT if you're looking for a place that will serve you up a filling meal in a jiffy then come on in!  Olivo's has roomy seating and counter space to dig in.  The atmosphere...authentic Latino decor and authentic Latino employees to match!  The owner is usually there and super friendly.  End of story- go and order a stack of pupusas and platanos and you'll never look back!
author: Jen S.

description: This place was great for Mexican food. I went there from the recommendations from Yelp and I was not disappointed. I had meant to order the carnitas - but instead ordered the steak. At first, I thought, I'm not going to be happy. But the steak was tender and juicy and flavorful. Washed it down with a Regia beer. Good times. Will definitely be coming back for seconds. This is going to be my new Mexican restaurant.
author: Adrian J.

description:
carne asada fries and bean and cheese pupusas.

that is all i am going to say about it.
author: Dot K.

description:
Really, really good Salvadorian food!

Good, if taciturn, service.  Papusas, tacos and fried plantains served too hot to eat!  There was a lot of food.

They have beer and wine, too and the prices are reasonable.

This place is excellent and everyone who likes Latin food should try it.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
author: The P.

description:
oh puposa.
oh puposa.


oh.


pupusa.

how you melt my heart like the cheese inside of you.
author: sara m.

description: Plantains.  Plantains.  Plantains.  Carne asada fresh from the grill and a mound of warm tortillas. Where were you when I lived two blocks away and pined for your flavors?  Regardless of proximity to home, I am happy to have this place in a neighborhood in which I consistently find myself.
author: L W.

description: The best papusas ever. The slaw is fantastic as well. I love this little family run business despite the fact that big mama has a terrible attitude! Great food at a great price!
author: Jack R.

description: awesome, awesome, awesome!!!!!! thank you olivo's for a delicious lunch....my fave were the carne asada fries!!!!! service is great, always welcoming and very friendly!!! =)
author: Damien H.

description:
I heart pupusas.  Previously, El Santaneca was my go to pupusa spot, albeit at 3am usually.  However, El Santaneca is in the middle of Egypt so unless my camel is handy, I'm not heading that direction regularly.
Olivo's, conversely, is in my neighborhood a scant 3 blocks away.  Salivating eagerly and being in a sleep deprived state, I decide pupusas are absolutely necessary today.  I rolled into Olivo's knowing pretty much what I wanted: platanos con frijoles y crema (refried bean with plantains and sour cream) and a couple of pupusas.  I place my order after the waitress behind the counter sort of ignores me for a couple of minutes.  Umm, okay...(quick look around) not crowded.  So I start waiting.  And waiting. And waiting.  I notice that the waitress is pleasant to those customers that speak Spanish but kinda has an attitude with those of us speaking in English.  Now, I'm NOT racist and I'm completely respectful of other cultures but I don't feel like my inability to speak Spanish should disqualify me from better service.  My food finally arrives and I pay just under $10 for my platanos con frijoles y crema, pork and cheese pupusa and plain cheese pupusa. Side of salsa and some cabbage salad included.  
I enjoyed the food but the pupusas at El Santaneca are more varied and the food a little better too.  However, I'll be back because it's a LOT better than most places in this 'hood for Latin cuisine.  I will place my order over the phone though because the service is more brusque than I want to deal with.
author: Jill D.

description:
i read the thread and cried a little. pee'd myself a little. and then, finally, smiled.

carne asada fries in SF.

hopes and dreams were fulfilled, like those of adolescent males on prom night, who asked Julie Blith to go with them because they knew she was easy. Julie had a heavenly rack - but, the fries, yes, back to the fries...

you know how high expectations tend to lead to failure and a sense of despair? yes, well, Olivo's got me.

Olivo's carne asada fries are not SD carne asada fries. its like they heard someone report what the ingredients were, and guessed that they all just piled together and miraculously became carne asada fries. but this is not true, sadly.

wrong kind of cheese (too oily and prone to meltiness), carne asada was not the best, fries were the mushy frozen type, and it was all, just, well, a gloop. too technical? it was gloopy, a pile, just a plop of ingredients without any sense of being carne asada fries.

props to Olivo's for listening to the Yelp community and giving it a try, but it just doesnt work. ill head back, try one of their plates, and see if another star can slide in on the scale.

ps
because of the yelpers, carne asada fries are now on the menu, under the specials
author: Darrell L.

description: Solid, homestyle flavors that don't lie. Had the chili verde burrito, pupusas, carne asada fries. Wonderful value, friendly owner/server. A new favorite for me. Dinner for two with leftovers at $22.
author: David Y.

description: Friendly staff and good burritos.  I only wish I had read the Yelp reviews before going--I would have ordered the carne asada fries.
author: QuodE D.

description: Simply having great pupusas so close to my new apartment should give them 5 stars, but I did not react well to the ones I got here.  They were VERY tasty, but something, either the pork or perhaps the cabbage accompaniment, gave me the runs.  I have a very telling stomach and it's pretty strong.  This told me some food might have stayed out a little longer than it should, or something wasn't cooked well enough.  This wasn't painful, just...unfortunate.  These pork and cheese pupusas are all I've ordered thus far and I will be going back to try the other dishes, because really, it could've just been a bad day for both of us.  The restaurant itself is clean and they have a counter, which I love.  The lady was friendly to me, so maybe she's moody sometimes. We'll see next time.
author: N. L.

description:
Carne Asada Fries. Enough said.

Pupusas - leftovers still good even after being reheated. In fact, they may taste better the next day.

I'm hungry now.
author: Angela T.

description: I was here yesterday, and I have to say, I like their pupusas but their service isn't the best. The lady who's there all the time isn't very friendly. But food is pretty good, but the chips are kinda salty! I don't really go for the ambiance, but my friend is in love with the food, and that's why I go. =P
author: Kissy F.

description: I'm just visiting from out of town, but there has to be better Mexican around. Chips seemed bagged, salsa was watery. Nobody in my party was impressed, although we all only got Mexican dishes, maybe the El Salvadorian is better?
author: Tea H.

description: get the carne asada fries. just get it. it's good. how is it good? my heart doesnt slow down when i share it with a friend, and it doesnt feel like you have a huge grease ball in your stomach thanks to the portion size.
author: Anthony C.

description: I had a combo plate with a chicken taco(delicious and so crispy) and a cheese enchillada(cheesy-gooey-delicious). I opted for the whole pinto bean which were also good and the rice was decent too. My friend had the carne asada fries(now listed on the menu) and it was a huge plate. I tasted some and it was very good. The chips and salsa were pretty decent too. I would definitly go back here again. I am interested in trying their pupusas.
author: Jack B.

description:
this place never fails to provide amazing grub,

finally got around to trying the pupusas. wow. amaaaazingggg

the carne asada fries are still bomb and the cali burritos are what dreams are made of. 

yea. im saying i dream of carne asada, french fries and guac. 

jeliz?
author: Jason B.

description: i am ae an aunt  pupusa expert especially since i am salvadorean and have an aunt that owns a pupuserian in vallejo but i think their pupusas come close. their caldo de res is also wonderful. But i have recently  been introduced to their steak and fries. Fries are house made just like my moma use to do it. insanly good. A great family owned restaurant but day time server is a bit rude. their salsa and chips are great too.
author: joselyn b.

description: Growing up 10 minutes away from the Mexican-American border I became an accidental expert in Mexican cuisine. Since moving to San Francisco I have struggled to find a Mexican restaurant that comes close to those I enjoyed in the past. To be clear Olivo's is a mix of Mexican and Salvadorian cuisine but it has become a regular stop of mine as it is the most consistently well produced food of this type. So often I am disappointed at other establishments with their bland beans/rice and poorly cooked meats with no flavor. You will not find this at Olivo's. They actually spend the time making the food correctly putting care into the dishes they serve. The soups are fantastic and so are the pupusas. As far as service I found that the more patient and pleasant a customer is the better the service is as well. Funny how being a nice person reaps rewards.
author: Justin B.

description: Pupusas and plantains are pretty much my favorite things in the world. Add in cheap coronas, excellent black beans, and huge portions and I'm in heaven. The pupusas are heavy on the cheese, but being cheese obsessed, that was fine with me. Fair warning- it is cash only.
author: Noelle Q.

description: Best salsa in the city. Above average burritos. Pork, chicken, are great. Beef is stew beef mediocre quality. Rice is great too so is yuka.  I'm scared of most Latin places fish standards, so I've never tried. Don't go in there acting all happy and talking in your painful Spanish.  She hates that and will only speak to you in English, probably to avoid added confusion.  They don't give a fuck about your indecisive menu staring ass or your business neither, tip her extra for being refreshing. Its a taste of service abroad. If you want something special like service u gotta make it known
author: R.C P.

description: Thanks for intentionally overcharging me. I noticed.
author: K J.

description: visited today with a few co-workers.  most of them ordered typical mexican fare - burritos, quesadillas and tacos - and all were extremely happy with their food.  I decided to go with the lomo saltado which was REALLY good!  Not the best I've had, but it's definitely a good value at $8.50.  AND, i found a bay leaf in my dish... something I usually only find when I'm at home eating my mom's food.  How's that for homecooking!
author: Erick A.

description: The cooking times are sometimes a little long, but Olivo's is one quality establishment.  Liz (daughter of the owners I believe) is awesome and friendly, and the food is always amazing.  Try the tilapia in green sauce and you won't be disappointed.  Otherwise, they're also known for being one of the only places in SF that offers carne asada fries - or in my case, carnitas fries - which, while not exactly up to San Diego standards, are a delicious endeavor into the SoCal mexican style.  This is definitely one of my favorite spots in SF, and being a local I'm always down to support.  Go try it!  Just don't go on Sunday's since they're closed.
author: Ryan L.

description:
cute that they still have a small piece of vietnamese art on the wall from the restaurant's previous incarnation.

recommended changes: better quality rice & better quality lettuce. wouldn't impact prices, but would greatly enhance meals.

one complaint: if you sit at the very rear table for two, you occasionally get a faint whiff of that unpleasant 'refrigeration' smell.
author: Friedrich G.

description:
I'm a SoCal transplant who came here for the carne asada fries, so I'm going to weigh in with my opinion on them for those looking to get their fix of SoCal styled mexican food in San Francisco.

The portion was a bit smaller than what I'm used to in SD, but I finished them feeling pretty full. Carne Asada tasted great. The plate was very oily, which I consider a good thing. The fries had guacamole, cheese, and sour cream. Onions and Jalapenos on the side.

I loved them, won't be missing SoCal mexican food as much anymore.
author: Ben T.

description: Good god, these are fantastic and an amazing value.   $3.50 for two pupusas.  Today I had my first pupusas ever, and I'm sold!
author: Uno N.

description:
I'd been looking for a place for some really good Mexican food, and this is just the place for it. I especially like the Chile Verde here, and they do steak very well too. The chips are just so-so, but the salsa is good.

Parking has always been easy here, and I've never had to wait for a table, either.
author: Tom G.

description: i'd never had a pupusa before. it was greasier and more delicious than i had expected. beef soup was piled high with a surprising mound of tasty vegetables, but the meat was a dry stringy mess. bf didn't like his really dry steak ranchera (although the stuff it came with was really good). i guess even though the pupusas are a definite 5, everything else was so-so. the service was pretty cold too. maybe we caught them on an off night and happened to order the crappy stuff? will try again.
author: Dana D.

description: I cannot get enough of this place!!!! I was so excited when this place opened in my neighborhood, because with my being from the central valley, I know a thing or two about good Mexican food. And now finally I can satisfy those cravings whenever I want. This is place is cheap, friendly and very tasty!!! And since they are El Salvadorian they also have pupusa's!!! I have even taken my from who is from El Salvador to eat here, and he agrees it is awesome!! Check it out, you won't be sorry you did. :)
author: jen e.

description: the atmosphere definitely leaves something to be desired, but pupusas are the jam.  so go and get some. get some.
author: Markus B.

description: i'm sorry but this place was a real disappointment. i ordered pupusas and the carne asada while my friend ordered their carne asada fries. first of all i've had many carne asada before from different restaurants but this one was eh. the meat had no flavor and was lukewarm. i think that is my first and last time going to this place. we heard about the raving reviews about their carne asada fries here and wasn't satisfied.  the fries they gave us was not fully cooked and truthfully it did not compare to the ones we had in SD.
author: Lynn P.

description: please go.  please get the pork and bean pupusas, the fried yuca and pork, the guac, and the seafood platter.  also, believe it or not, get a carafe of wine.  i'm sorry, did you say 6.95$ for a liter?  what?  nothing fancy obviously, but much more decent than you'd expect, and went very well with the food.
author: James R.

description: Sadly, the best thing about this eating experience was the waitress.  We saw a guy at the counter eating a salad, and though it was not on the menu, she had the kitchen make one for us.  She was pleasant and very friendly, but you don't chose where to eat based 100% on nice servers.  The food was greasy, to say the least.  Aside from the extra load of oil/lard/whatever, the flavoring wasn't that great at all and the meat wasn't of good quality.  Very fatty dark meat in the chicken dish.  The steak dish was surprisingly better.  Price was fine, but wouldn't pay that much again for that low quality food.
author: R A.

description: Unimpressed. Went there after reading the rave reviews on Yelp, looking for something different. They were out of carnitas, so I got pork and cheese pupusas. One was cheese-only, and a little too think for my taste. The salsa was bland, the guacamole was just ok. My girlfriend had a chopped steak dish with "fries"---turns out the fries were part of the stir-fry and the meat was tough. It was edible though, the beans were good, and we ate as much as we could (the portions were giant), but when the woman came to take our plates, she seemed insulted that we didn't finish everything "What you didn't like it?" I think she said. Oh well, you can't win them all.
author: Justin W.

description: Carnitas burritos :)   Im so glad ive finally found a good Taqueria in the TL!
author: anthony i.

description: The service was great, place was clean, however the food must have had an "off" night that night.. We went on recomendation of ALL the staff at the hotel we were staying at, we went there with high hopes but left hungry.  I think the batch of beans they put in there burritos must have been visited by the salt fairy, because it was like licking a salt block. Unfortunately the meal was unsalvagable, yet the people were friendly and they kept checking on us.  I wish we had more chances to give them a second shot, however time just didnt allow.  According to other rave reviews it seems we just caught them on a bad day.
author: Nick F.

description: Great place. The food is very tasty and the portions are large. The service is friendly, and the restaurant is clean and well maintained.
author: C W.
